content.description: There are a few variations but all follow the bolt line either left center or right. 7 bolts and anchors. This can be led to the rappel rings with 8 draws to pull ropes.
content.location: This is currently the furthest left sport route. Right of some broken basalt with a shrubbery about half way up on a ledge

content.description: Fun slab climbing short but sweet! This route is often wet and better later in the day after receiving some sun.
content.location: As your coming down the approach gully trail you will see a black water streaked slab on your right. Water streak down follows the Black water streak.

content.description: As of this posting still a project. Should go in the low 12's high 11's. Toprope curently off of gear and trees
content.protection: Toprope off gear and a tree
content.location: Above the boulder field left of the break after Bonasi Pipeline

content.description: Follow the steep dihedral to easier slab above.
This is a great route for the new leader. Fun moderate climbing with just enough space between bolts to sharpen your lead head.
content.location: This route takes the ridge between the water streak down slab and the main part of the wall.

content.description: Start on good holds, which will slowly give way to delicate slab and crimps.
content.location: To the climber’s left of Water Streak Down

content.description: Fun little romp up a pronounced corner that splits two sides of the cliff. I'm sure it's possible to lead but have no info on gear.
content.location: Right of Bonsai Pipeline starting around the corner and topping out left.

content.description: More moderate climbing up a gully area of the main cliff. Starts on a small ground level ledge and tend left. 6 bolts to top rope anchors this can also be led to the rappel rings for this side of the cliff if you want to top out and pull ropes. The second option requires 7 draws.
content.location: Ledge center cliff by several small maple whips. Left leaning bolt line.

content.description: Climb the heavily featured face through four bolts, and end at ring anchors. There are also two bolts on the top if you want to top out.
content.location: To the climber’s left of Freya and Loki.

content.description:
Fun short climb, starts out with a ledge traverse that zig zags its way up to the main feature, a slab with a nice crack that lets you get a whole leg in and crawl your way up, if you so choose. Larger pro required, a 4 just fit the main crack ...5 or larger useful . A little dirty and a little mossy but that just adds to the adventure.To get down you can walk-off down to your left back to the sunset gully. From the top you can see 'water streak down'.

 A top rope can be set-up, there are plenty of cracks at the top to make an anchor using pro.
content.protection: Lager Pro, 3,4,5 for main crack, .75, 1, 2 also useful.
content.location: On the approach to Sunset Gully, the cliff on your right before you reach the base of the main walls. Tall pine sits on a ledge at the base of the climb, many loose rocks and small shrubbery on the approach to the wall. A small scramble up to the ledge is necessary.

content.description: Furthest right route on main wall. Follow jugs up the slab to a balancy ending.
content.protection: SS fixe hardware. Four bolts plus anchors
content.location: Furthest right route. First route encountered from trail.

content.description: Good crack climb just a little to high for most to boulder. Start by scrambling to a small ledge where the crack starts and fire up to the top!!
content.location: Far left of the Northwest Gully just past a small chute

content.description: Climb the vertical dyke. Good holds, but you just gotta find ‘em.
content.protection: SS Fixe Hardware. 4 bolts plus ring anchors.
content.location: Climber's right of the main wall. See photo.

content.description: Little slab and corner with fun easy moves. I've included this because it was my personal first outdoor climb in 2004 -Brandon Snyder-
Just left of schoolhouse Ridge is dark Skies. Five bolts lead to a two bolt anchor. The route can also be led to the rap rings for schoolhouse Ridge if you're looking to top out and pull ropes.
content.location: The route starts below an obvious ledge with freshly exposed rock. Follow the bolt line through the steep section and enjoy the mellow finish.

content.description: One of the tallest climbs on sugarloaf! Gear is good but a bit runout! Avoid the block pulling into the crux by traversing low and looking for a horiziontal placment that is really solid. From there climb stright up left of the bonsai pine!!
content.protection: Standard rack up to #1 Camalot extra gear for anchor

content.description: Easy way to get to the top of the climbs from the boulder field. Easy 3rd class climbing but listed as 4th class because of fall expousre
content.location: Obvious ledge heading let from the start of First Day Out

content.description: Home to some of the longest climbs on sugarloaf. Sunset Gully has climbing of every style. Sport, traditional, and bouldering all in one area. Moderate sport climbing with harder projects in the works. Obscure and bold traditional climbs and a talus field with aesthetic bouldering lines with lots of harder potential. Afternoon sun minutes from town and a quick approach make this an enjoyable evening crag.
